intro: Surwala robusta, commonly known as the Indian chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Fagaceae and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and smooth, grey bark. The tree produces edible nuts enclosed in a spiny husk, which are typically harvested in late autumn. Surwala robusta thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Its seeds are an important food source for various wildlife species.
